comments.body: Are we starting to prefix Go packages generally?
I think it is a good idea, because we will end eventually conflicting with other packages. I think we might as well start early.
although I am not sure it makes sense to prefix with "go-" projects like kubernetes, singularity and terraform.

Yeah, we went through similar gyrations with Python. Not really trying to suggest how it should be solved with Go.

More mentioning this as it seems we are developing a templating framework here for Go packages and wanted to get a sense to what extent this is needed/will be used in the future. Probably worth mentioning your thoughts on prefixing with Go packages somewhere with higher visibility like the webpage repo to get feedback from others.
What's the reason for using different sources on different platforms?

Something strange is happening with libarchive on windows and both the zip and tar.gz.

See the AppVeyor logs
  - https://ci.appveyor.com/project/conda-forge/staged-recipes/builds/21304030
  - https://ci.appveyor.com/project/conda-forge/staged-recipes/builds/21304253

The only fix I had at the moment was to pick it up directly from git.

Interesting. Yeah the Windows symlink story has been weak historically. Looks like `libarchive` doesn't really have a solution for that.

That said, we might be able to solve it with [this patch]( https://github.com/AnacondaRecipes/libarchive-feedstock/blob/99d01d0f5a4c197e1c807e3e020168bc92f5c557/recipe/0010-Use-CreateSymbolicLinkW-on-Windows-for-symlinks-WIP.patch ), which is being worked on in PR ( https://github.com/libarchive/libarchive/pull/1030 ). Could you please raise an issue about this on the conda-forge `libarchive` feedstock?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +14,18 @@    sha256: 65c31c8d51513dfabd25f1f37ecd22a38ab3bcdd5893bdf10f54941250e4f19d  # [unix]
    git_url: https://{{ goname }}  # [win]
    git_tag: v{{ version }}  # [win]
